main event: A witness observed an unidentified flying object at approximately 60 degrees elevation in Coloma, Michigan on April 2, 1962.
interesting points: The object exhibited a sudden shacking motion before it rapidly disappeared., The witness initially thought it was a crashed aircraft after seeing the object in the woods., It was suggested that the sighting could be attributed to a re-entering satellite or meteorite., A second report from April 27, 1962, described two fireballs observed in the evening., The fireballs were noted to travel much faster than a plane, with one appearing brilliant green.
witness description: Individuals including a husband and wife duo, and a single witness reporting to the Air Force.
